results.title: C'est Parti!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane receives orders from Morales to substitute the jewels back on arrival in Montreal. To convince him to obey orders, Morales reminds him that Olympe is now a de facto accomplice since she is the one who cleared the jewels through customs. In Paris, Bicou and Jacinthe are in possession of a necklace without knowing that it is part of the treasure. Lulu is trying is hardest to recover them from the children.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Le Sac a Malices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
The Canadian Police now suspects Olympe to have run away with the real jewels. Stephane must hand back an empty bag to his accomplices. Lulu and Morales make a last attempt at terrorising the children into handing back the necklace and the ring.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Un 'diam' Pour Jacinthe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Alerted by Inspector Boudot, the Canadian Police starts to follow Stephane. Gloria manages to speak to Olympe about Stephane’s trouble with both Morales and the law. She also tells her where the jewels have been hidden.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This film is a promotional device for the Disney animated feature “The Fox and the hound”. It is a cautionary tale about a young fox named Tod is taken in by an old woman after his mother is killed by a hunter. Full of mischief, young Tod befriends Copper, a hound dog pup. As they grow up, however, their friendship becomes endangered by what they have become - Copper is a hunting dog, and Tod is his prey. Live action written by Philip Abbot who stars as “Uncle Phil.”
results.title_for_label: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: Le 5eme Dessous
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
The children are taken by force by Lulu and led underneath the Opera House. Lulu demands to be taken to the props department and the jewels. The Police is searching the whole House.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: C'est Jeudi, Jacinthe!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Lulu and Stephane have managed to swap the last jewels in Olympe’s (the star of the ballet) dressing room. When she arrives at 8 am to pick up her luggage before going to the airport, she discovers the night watchman tied up in the shower. She immediately sounds the alert. Meanwhile, Lulu and Stephane are still trying to find a way out of the Opera House. When they do so, they bump into Jacinthe who recognises the bag from the previous night.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: La Fille Aux Yeux D'email
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane is still trying to operate the subitution of jewels in spite of the constant interruptions of Bicou and his best friend Jacinthe. He hopes to be out of the Opera House just in time to reach ‘L’oiseau de feu’, the cabaret owned by Morales wher he performs his dance number with Gloria. Instead, he finds himself locked up on the roof of the Opera House.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Une Nuit a L'opera
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane is locked up on the roof of the Opera House with the real jewels still in his bag. After owning up to Morales, he is forced to return to the Opera and make a second attempt of substitution under the watchful eye of Lulu, Morales’ accomplice. As they reach the dressing rooms, they are interrupted by a night watchman doing his round.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.
